intro: Tristemon biflorus, commonly known as the two-flowered tristemon, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its erect, herbaceous stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink to purple in color, arranged in clusters at the ends of the branches. Tristemon biflorus is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and stream banks. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
